org.mapsforge.map.reader

Class IndexCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mapsforge.map.reader.IndexCache

  • public class IndexCache
extends Object
    A cache for database index blocks with a fixed size and LRU policy.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int INDEX_ENTRIES_PER_BLOCK
      Number of index entries that one index block consists of.
      private Map<IndexCacheEntryKey,byte[]> map 
      private RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile 
      private static int SIZE_OF_INDEX_BLOCK
      Maximum size in bytes of one index block.

      Destroy the cache at the end of its lifetime.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexCache

        public IndexCache(RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile,
                  int capacity)
        Parameters:
        randomAccessFile - the map file from which the index should be read and cached.
        capacity - the maximum number of entries in the cache.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the capacity is negative.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy the cache at the end of its lifetime.

      • getIndexEntry

        public long getIndexEntry(SubFileParameter subFileParameter,
                          long blockNumber)
                   throws IOException
        Returns the index entry of a block in the given map file. If the required index entry is not cached, it will be read from the map file index and put in the cache.
        Parameters:
        subFileParameter - the parameters of the map file for which the index entry is needed.
        blockNumber - the number of the block in the map file.
        Returns:
        the index entry.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during reading.
